name: thedailybeast
text: After a spate of Islamist attacks in France, President Macron decried a “crisis in Islam,” intervened in mosques and ordered a border crackdown. Now he’s fighting off the backlash. https://t.co/QsCQJPSVmY

name: thedailybeast
text: The Department of Homeland Security hit back at President Trump’s false claims of widespread voter fraud and election rigging in a strongly worded statement https://t.co/E4ttR1brob

name: thedailybeast
text: The lawyer for Kenosha shooter Kyle Rittenhouse is on a Twitter tear again—this time, urging supporters to “dust off those Second Amendment rights” and not let China “steal” the election from lame-duck President Trump https://t.co/lgFsUbib3K

name: thedailybeast
text: "There’s a lot of speculation about why Republicans are doing this," writes @mattklewis, of the refusal to concede the election. "Fear of Trump. Fear of the base." https://t.co/WBmVrFzQ0a

name: thedailybeast
text: Stacey Abrams is credited with making President-elect Joe Biden's mission of flipping Georgia blue possible. Now, allies say she's eyeing another gubernatorial run in 2022. (And who can blame her?) https://t.co/OfKFJGkVJn

name: thedailybeast
text: Mark Zuckerberg told Facebook employees that Steve Bannon had not violated enough of the company’s policies enough times to be suspended from its social network https://t.co/0KmBEINExn

name: thedailybeast
text: Sen. Rand Paul went on Fox News and urged all those who have recovered from COVID-19 to immediately ditch their masks and go “celebrate” in public, claiming they are now “immune” https://t.co/JaDZcdGFyD

name: thedailybeast
text: Will Kamala Harris’ husband Doug Emhoff, America's First Second Husband, become a fashion icon? Whatever, his #DougHive fans are already fiercely cheering him on. https://t.co/qEIesXggiq
